Identifying Characteristics: Stems: rooted to sediments, often loosely branching with multiple leaves per rooted stem
Leaves: small to medium (3-10cm wide), rounded, heart-shaped, entire, slightly scalloped margin
Flowers: showy, distinctly-fringed yellow flowers (3 to 4 cm in diameter) occur June â€“ September, Flowers emerge from water on slender stalks with 1 to 5 flowers per stalk.
Fruits/Seeds: fruit capsule is 2.5 cm long and contains numerous seeds. The seeds are oval and flat (about 3.5 mm long) and hairy along their outer edges.
Habitat: From damp mud to 12 foot depth
Range: Range: Most of New England (not Maine) and other US States
